page.title: 18Religion and churches
page.content: There are 3 churches and chapels in the west of the area all dating from the late 19th century when population increased and non-conformism spread. {Church of England}- St. Michael's Church(1877) stands on a hillside with a view over Lumb and was a daughter church of Newchurch(3 miles SW). It is a large stone building with a tower. The inside has been renovated, the original nave and choir areas no longer in use. The congregation usually numbers 25.{Lumb Baptist,} founded in 1827 was built in 1871 over the culverted river. It is a large building and incorporates many smaller rooms and a large hall. A lively church,it has large congregations. {Eden Methodist}was built in 1874 by migrants from Cornwall as an exact replica of their old chapel. It has little support today.
